intro: Ruellia macrocalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the warm regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant is typically perennial, often growing as a shrub or herbaceous plant depending on the climate. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens. Ruellia macrocalyx is also known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade.
